item.title: GetGithubCredentials
item.description: Go to Github site Open the Github URL into your browser. Register an account and login. Go the the credential page Click on the ‘profile logo’ on the top right corner of the page. Click on the ‘setting’. At the bottom of the left bar, click on ‘Developer Setting’. Click the ‘OAuth Apps’ on the left left bar. Click on the ‘New OAuth App’ button at the right hand area of the page.

item.title: Quick guide to obtain your cloudinary credentials
item.description: Go to Cloudinary site Open the Cloudinary URL into your browser. Register an account and login to the dashboard Obtain the credentials In the dashboard, under the ‘Account Details’. You should be able to find your cloudinary credentials. It should look something like the following Cloud name: ugdhfygwegu API Key: 1754611353467 Copy to clipboard API Secret: *************************** Copy to clipboard Reveal API Environment variable: CLOUDINARY_URL=cloudinary://***************:*************************** Copy to clipboard Reveal DONE!

item.title: Quick guide to obtain your Google client credentials
item.description: Go to GCP [Google Cloud Platform] console Open the GCP URL into your browser. Sign in to your GCP. Click on the console button on the top right part of the page. Tick the 2 boxes to agree if this is the first time you are accessing GCP. Create a GCP project Find the burger button at the top left part of the page. Click on the 4th option called ‘APIs & Services’.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.
this is a micro blog used for short updates and link sharing, you can configure its behavior in config.toml

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

item.title: About
item.description: Written in Go, Hugo is an open source static site generator available under the Apache Licence 2.0. Hugo supports TOML, YAML and JSON data file types, Markdown and HTML content files and uses shortcodes to add rich content. Other notable features are taxonomies, multilingual mode, image processing, custom output formats, HTML/CSS/JS minification and support for Sass SCSS workflows. Hugo makes use of a variety of open source projects including: https://github.
